travelers.notes: Business partners (travel agents) and BFFs. Both in 50s, experienced travelers, foodies, good physical health. First time to Portugal. Scouting trip to learn destination for future client sales.

preferences.vibe: Pack it full — culture, food, scenic villages, beaches, shopping. Dual purpose: personal adventure + business reconnaissance.
preferences.budget: Cost-conscious with selective splurges for right experiences
preferences.mobility: No restrictions. Kim prefers shorter car rides (no long drives).
preferences.transportation: Train-based itinerary. No rental car. Day trips from two bases.
mustHave: Shopping - fashion for Susie, unique/off-beaten-path for Kim
See key tourist spots to understand for future clients
avoid: Rental car if practical to skip
preferences.kimPreferences: Mountains, villages, hiking, unique finds, shorter drives
preferences.lodgingPreferences: Boutique hotels or small B&Bs preferred, one room with two beds, reasonably priced

flights.notes: Round-trip Lisbon recommended. Delta JFK-Porto doesn't start until May 2026, so open-jaw not practical for March dates.

alternatives: MSY → JFK → LIS could save money but 2hr drive
routing.reasoning: Kim has Delta status, earns miles. JFK has premium lounges. Overnight transatlantic preferred.

outbound.notes: Overnight flight JFK-LIS. DL272 departs JFK ~8:15pm, arrives LIS 8:00am.

return.notes: DL273 departs LIS ~10:00am, arrives JFK ~1:00pm. Connect home same day.

itinerary.summary: Two bases (Lisbon 4 nights, Porto 4 nights) with day trips by train. No rental car.

locations.name: Lisbon
locations.purpose: Capital city base. Day trips to Sintra and Cascais.

locations.name: Porto
locations.purpose: Northern base. Walkable city, possible Douro day trip.

requirements.lisbon: Central location (Chiado, Baixa, or Alfama). Walking distance to Rossio and Cais do Sodré stations for day trips. 4 nights.
requirements.porto: Ribeira or Baixa area. Walking distance to São Bento station. 4 nights.
requirements.roomType: One room with two beds (twin preferred)
requirements.style: Boutique hotel or small B&B preferred

lodging.recommendation: Premium tier - best value for quality/location balance

value.whyItWorks: 18th-century building, excellent reviews, 5-min walk to both Rossio and Cais do Sodré stations
Historic Ribeira location, walking distance to São Bento, 18 rooms, cozy atmosphere

premium.roomType: Classic Twin Room or Superior Twin Room
amenities: Free smartphone with unlimited data during stay
Walking tours with Guest Manager Pedro
premium.whyItWorks: Perfect location between Rossio (Sintra trains) and Cais do Sodré (Cascais trains). Larger-than-average rooms for Lisbon. Free smartphone = great for navigating. TripAdvisor Travelers' Choice. Great reviews for staff.
premium.pricingSource: Kayak shows €146-187/night recent bookings. Direct booking often best rate.
premium.cpBookable: 4-star likely in CP Maxx - verify availability

premium.address: Rua do Infante D. Henrique 55-61, Ribeira
premium.whyItWorks: Only 16 rooms - intimate boutique feel. 14th-century restored building. 2-min walk to Ribeira Square. Brunch until 1pm perfect for late mornings. TripAdvisor rated 4.8/5. Excellent reviews for staff, location, breakfast.
premium.note: Property closed Jan 18-29, 2026 but open for March dates

premium.address: Rua do Infante D. Henrique 1, Ribeira
premium.roomType: Carris Twin Room (street view or river view)
premium.whyItWorks: 90 rooms in refurbished historic building overlooking Douro. 5-min walk to São Bento Station. More amenities than Exmo (gym, larger restaurant). Booking.com rated 8.4. Good value option in premium tier.
premium.pricingSource: Kayak shows $159-264 recent bookings. Starting price €112/night.

luxury.whyItWorks: Only 28 rooms. Renovated 18th-century building on emblematic square. Strong Portuguese cultural focus. Excellent restaurant on-site.

luxury.roomType: Twin room in Original or Custom building
amenities: Two distinct buildings (Original = classic, Custom = modern)
luxury.whyItWorks: Brand new (opened 2024). TripAdvisor ranked #16 best hotel worldwide. Two buildings offer different vibes - choose classic Portuguese or contemporary.
luxury.cpBookable: New boutique - may need direct booking

tours.recommendation: Food tours are perfect for you both as foodies. Sintra tour saves logistics hassle. Douro DIY train = scenic without wine focus.

lisbon.name: Devour Lisbon: The Ultimate Portuguese Food Tour
includes: Enough food for a full meal
highlights: Famous pastel de nata custard tarts
Walks through Baixa, Chiado, Cais do Sodré
lisbon.alcoholNote: Tour includes wine/ginjinha but NON-ALCOHOLIC OPTIONS AVAILABLE - just notify when booking. They accommodate dietary needs.
lisbon.whyForYou: Perfect for foodies! Get oriented on Day 2, learn local food spots for rest of trip. Non-alcoholic options for Susie.
lisbon.clientValue: Great tour to recommend to future clients - excellent reviews, reasonable price

lisbon.name: Sintra Small-Group Tour with Pena Palace & Regaleira
includes: Entrance tickets to Pena Palace & Park
Stops at Cabo da Roca and/or Cascais
highlights: Continental Europe's westernmost point (Cabo da Roca)
lisbon.whyForYou: Removes logistics hassle for mountainous area. Guide handles crowds and timing. Kim gets mountain views, both get fairytale palaces.
lisbon.clientValue: TOP recommendation for future clients - Sintra is a must-see, guided tour is worth it for first-timers
lisbon.alternativeOption: DIY by train (~€5 RT) + palace tickets (~€30-35) saves ~$50 but requires more planning and lines

lisbon.name: Lisbon Essential Walking Tour
lisbon.whyForYou: Budget option if you want a guide for orientation. Could do arrival day afternoon if not too tired.
lisbon.clientValue: Good budget option for clients, but food tour provides more value

porto.name: Porto Secret Food Tour
highlights: Views of Dom Luis I Bridge
porto.alcoholNote: Includes wine but alternatives available on request
porto.whyForYou: Get oriented to Porto's food scene on first full day. Same company as other great food tours worldwide.
porto.clientValue: Excellent tour to recommend - Porto food scene is incredible

porto.name: Taste Porto Food Tours
highlights: Featured on Anthony Bourdain's Parts Unknown
porto.whyForYou: Alternative to Secret Food Tours - more prestigious reputation. Better for wine-loving clients.
porto.clientValue: Premium option for clients who want elevated experience

douro.name: DIY Douro Valley Scenic Train
highlights: One of Europe's most scenic train rides
Follows Douro River through wine country
Free time to explore Pinhão village
douro.importantNote: ⚠️ TRACK WORK: Trains replaced by buses between Caide & Régua until April 2, 2026. Your dates (March 29) may be affected - verify closer to trip!

trainInfo.tips: Sit on RIGHT side going out for best river views

douro.whyForYou: PERFECT for Susie - scenic valley experience WITHOUT wine tour focus. Kim gets mountain/valley views. Budget-friendly. Authentic local experience.
douro.clientValue: Budget alternative to wine tours for clients who don't drink or want DIY adventure

douro.name: Douro Valley Small-Group Tour (Non-Wine Focus Option)

douro.whyForYou: Only if train service disrupted. Otherwise DIY train is better fit.

freeAlternatives.name: Foz do Douro Beach Day
freeAlternatives.description: Beach neighborhood at mouth of Douro River. Take Tram 1 from Ribeira. Beaches, seafood restaurants, lighthouse, relaxed vibe.
freeAlternatives.whyForYou: Backup for Day 7 if weather poor or train disrupted. Susie gets beach time!

freeAlternatives.name: Self-Guided Alfama Walking
freeAlternatives.description: Wander narrow streets of Lisbon's oldest neighborhood. Miradouros (viewpoints), street art, local life, Fado bars.
freeAlternatives.whyForYou: Do this morning of Day 2 before food tour

rentalCar.notes: Skipping rental car. Train-based itinerary is more practical and cost-effective.

localTransport.porto: Metro, trams, walking. Very walkable city center.

packingGuide.weather: March temperatures range from 55-65°F (12-18°C). Chance of rain.

footwear: Comfortable walking shoes essential - cobblestone streets everywhere
Stylish sneakers or supportive flats work perfectly
Avoid flip-flops which mark you as a tourist
clothing: Well-fitted jeans, chinos, capris, or casual dresses
Layers essential - light jacket, cardigan, or versatile scarf
Modest tops for church visits - shoulders should be covered

suggestions: Nice blouse or sweater with dark jeans or tailored pants
Casual dress with cardigan or blazer
Comfortable but stylish low heels, ankle boots, or dressy flats
avoid: Athletic wear, shorts, or overly casual clothing at dinner

generalTips: Stick to neutrals and earthy tones - black, navy, olive, cream blend in well
Portuguese women tend toward classic, understated elegance over flashy
Versatile scarf doubles as style piece and cover-up for churches
Pack pieces that mix and match easily
Bring a compact umbrella for March
packingGuide.proTip: A lightweight, wrinkle-resistant wardrobe will serve you well. Choose fabrics that travel easily and can be dressed up or down!
